4. Biochemical properties: Citrobacter meridianamericanus is positive for catalase and oxidase activities. It can utilize citrate as a sole carbon source and is able to decarboxylate lysine.

5. Habitat and distribution: This species has been isolated from soil samples collected in Central and South America, suggesting it is indigenous to that geographic region.

Significance: While Citrobacter meridianamericanus is not considered a major human pathogen, some Citrobacter species can occasionally cause opportunistic infections in immunocompromised individuals.
